http://schema.org/member.description: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals. Supersedes members, musicGroupMember. Inverse property: memberOf.

http://schema.org/parentOrganization.description: The larger organization that this organization is a branch of, if any. Supersedes branchOf. Inverse property: subOrganization.

http://schema.org/memberOf.description: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs. Inverse property: member.

http://schema.org/aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

http://schema.org/hasOfferCatalog.description: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

http://schema.org/foundingLocation.description: The place where the Organization was founded.

http://schema.org/owns.description: Products owned by the organization or person.

http://schema.org/review.description: A review of the item. Supersedes reviews.

http://schema.org/containedInPlace.description: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it. Supersedes containedIn. Inverse property: containsPlace.

http://schema.org/location.description: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

http://schema.org/department.description: A relationship between an organization and a department of that organization, also described as an organization (allowing different urls, logos, opening hours). For example: a store with a pharmacy, or a bakery with a cafe.

http://schema.org/openingHours.description: The opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'.- Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr, Sa, Su.- Times are specified using 24:00 time. For example, 3pm is specified as 15:00. - Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>. - If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.

http://schema.org/description.description: A short description of the item.

http://schema.org/makesOffer.description: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person. Inverse property: offeredBy.

http://schema.org/event.description: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action. Supersedes events.

http://schema.org/additionalProperty.description: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org. Note: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

http://schema.org/taxID.description: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

http://schema.org/isicV4.description: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

http://schema.org/founder.description: A person who founded this organization. Supersedes founders.

http://schema.org/legalName.description: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

http://schema.org/vatID.description: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

http://schema.org/image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

http://schema.org/hasMap.description: A URL to a map of the place. Supersedes map, maps.

http://schema.org/dissolutionDate.description: The date that this organization was dissolved.

http://schema.org/hasPOS.description: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

http://schema.org/photo.description: A photograph of this place. Supersedes photos.

http://schema.org/branchCode.description: A short textual code (also called "store code") that uniquely identifies a place of business. The code is typically assigned by the parentOrganization and used in structured URLs. For example, in the URL http://www.starbucks.co.uk/store-locator/etc/detail/3047 the code "3047" is a branchCode for a particular branch.

http://schema.org/potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

http://schema.org/alumni.description: Alumni of an organization. Inverse property: alumniOf.

http://schema.org/geo.description: The geo coordinates of the place.

http://schema.org/sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

http://schema.org/employee.description: Someone working for this organization. Supersedes employees.

http://schema.org/brand.description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

http://schema.org/duns.description: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

http://schema.org/award.description: An award won by or for this item. Supersedes awards.

http://schema.org/openingHoursSpecificat.description: The opening hours of a certain place.

http://schema.org/priceRange.description: The price range of the business, for example $$$.

http://schema.org/numberOfEmployees.description: The number of employees in an organization e.g. business.

http://schema.org/seeks.description: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

http://schema.org/areaServed.description: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided. Supersedes serviceArea.

http://schema.org/mainEntityOfPage.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details. Inverse property: mainEntity.

http://schema.org/containsPlace.description: The basic containment relation between a place and another that it contains. Inverse property: containsPlace.

http://schema.org/contactPoint.description: A contact point for a person or organization. Supersedes contactPoints.

http://schema.org/subOrganization.description: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary. See also: the more specific 'department' property. Inverse property: parentOrganization.

http://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.description: The Global Location Number (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

http://schema.org/currenciesAccepted.description: The currency accepted (in ISO 4217 currency format).

http://schema.org/foundingDate.description: The date that this organization was founded.

http://schema.org/additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

http://schema.org/naics.description: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

http://schema.org/image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

For example, 3pm is specified as 15:00. - Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>. - If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.
